sub_topic: Identifying the cut vertices and bridges in a graph.
message_1:
Consider the following graph: 

![graph](https://i.imgur.com/sCODb7C.png)

Identify the cut vertices and bridges in the graph.
message_2:
A cut vertex is a vertex whose removal increases the number of connected components in the graph. A bridge is an edge whose removal increases the number of connected components in the graph.

In the given graph, the cut vertices are:
- Vertex 1: If we remove vertex 1, the graph will be split into two connected components: {2, 3, 4, 5} and {6, 7, 8, 9}.
- Vertex 4: If we remove vertex 4, the graph will be split into two connected components: {1, 2, 3} and {5, 6, 7, 8, 9}.

The bridges in the graph are:
- Edge (1, 4): If we remove this edge, the graph will be split into two connected components: {1, 6, 7, 8, 9} and {2, 3, 4, 5}.
- Edge (4, 5): If we remove this edge, the graph will be split into two connected components: {1, 2, 3, 4} and {5, 6, 7, 8, 9}.
